intro: Pimpinella rotundifolia, commonly known as round-leaved parsley, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, celery, and dill, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features heart-shaped or rounded leaves that are finely divided. Its flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of the carrot family. Pimpinella rotundifolia is often found in dry, rocky soils and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
